result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Tyacke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Set at $2,060.00 payable to North Shore Bank located at 10533 W. National Avenue.  Joint and several with codefendant Christa W.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-------------------------------------
Court costs and  all applicable surcharges, assessments, DNA surcharge waived as defendant has a large amount of restitution to pay on this case and 15CF2344, and was ordered on 15CF2344 to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first year of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No  contact with North Shore Bank located at 10533 W. National Avenue, Stephanie B.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Court waives DNA sample as defendant is to provide DNA sample on 15CF2344.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

**12-23-2016/ Judge T Christopher Dee
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to include a DNA surcharge totaling $250.00 on count one.
*

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed. 
Court order: Therefore, it is hereby ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a DNA surcharge totaling $250.00 on count one.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. SPC
Letter seeking clarification on mandatory DNA surcharge that does not appear on judgment of conviction, forwarded to Judge Dee (successor).  jbs

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing SEPTEMBER 23, 2015 received and filed. (39 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PAUL OBERER.
The court reporter on the plea date of 8-20-2015 was incorrectly entered.   Change made to reflect the correct court reporter.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by Timothy D.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS,  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first year of this sentence
-Restitution set at $2,060.00 payable to North Shore Bank located at 10533 W. National Avenue;  joint/several with co-defendant Christa W. to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Court Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are WAIVED as defendant has a large amount of restitution to pay on this case and 15CF2344.  Defendant also ordered on 15CF2344 to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments
-Court WAIVES DNA sample and all applicable surcharges as assessments as defendant is to provide DNA sample on 15CF2344 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with North Shore Bank located at 10533 W. National Avenue; Stephanie B. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Danielle M Tyacke not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea and sentencing.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Danielle M Tyacke not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, Defendant Danielle M Tyacke not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:  Any North Shore Bank.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Danielle M Tyacke in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
